translated: To explain the result of solitude, he says:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la legs par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la legs par gnas pa ste /
translated: Mindful means well-established in the four applications of mindfulness.

original: dran pa 'dis ni lam gyi tshogs ston pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa 'dis ni lam gyi tshogs ston pa yin no //
translated: This mindfulness shows the accumulation of the path.

original: dge slong ni nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge slong ni nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom pa'i phyir te /
translated: The monk is one who has destroyed all the defilements.

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan to //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan to //
translated: This is the teaching of nirvana with a remainder of aggregates.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach nirvana without a remainder of aggregates,

original: kun tu rgyus zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kun tu rgyus zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe wandering mendicant.‚Äù

original: mya ngan las 'das pa nyid de //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa nyid de //
translated: This is nirvana itself.

original: gal te de ltar nyes dmigs yin pa de lta na ni bsod snyoms la sogs pa btsal bar mi bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar nyes dmigs yin pa de lta na ni bsod snyoms la sogs pa btsal bar mi bya'am zhe na /
translated: If there is such a disadvantage, then one should not seek alms, etc.?

original: smras pa / kham gyi zas kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / kham gyi zas kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause of the food of morsels,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is to say,

original: srog chags @207b kha cig g-yan pa'i nad kyis btab ste /
analyzed: srog chags @207b kha cig g-yan pa'i nad kyis btab ste /
translated: there are some living beings who are afflicted with the disease of leprosy.

original: bde ba la reg par mi gnas shing dgon par yang dga' ba med la /
analyzed: bde ba la reg par mi gnas shing dgon par yang dga' ba med la /
translated: They do not enjoy contact with pleasure, nor do they enjoy the forest,

original: dur khrod du yang dga' ba med de /
analyzed: dur khrod du yang dga' ba med de /
translated: nor do they enjoy the charnel ground.

original: des mngon par gtses bzhin du dus byas so //
analyzed: des mngon par gtses bzhin du dus byas so //
translated: While being tormented by that, they die.

original: de bzhin du dge slong gang rnyed pa dang / bkur stis zil gyis non par gyur cing yongs su 'dzin pa'i sems yod pa de ni grong du yang dga' ba med la dgon par yang dga' ba med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong gang rnyed pa dang / bkur stis zil gyis non par gyur cing yongs su 'dzin pa'i sems yod pa de ni grong du yang dga' ba med la dgon par yang dga' ba med de /
translated: Likewise, a monk who is overcome by gain and honor and has a mind of grasping has no joy in the village and no joy in the wilderness.

original: ji srid na nyams par 'gyur zhing dge slong dag 'di ni 'chi ba yin te /
analyzed: ji srid na nyams par 'gyur zhing dge slong dag 'di ni 'chi ba yin te /
translated: As long as he is not ruined, the monks say, ‚ÄúThis is death.

original: gang 'phags pa'i chos 'di la gcig tu bslab pa gtong zhing nyams par 'gyur ro zhes de skad gsungs pa na dge slong rnams yid byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa'i chos 'di la gcig tu bslab pa gtong zhing nyams par 'gyur ro zhes de skad gsungs pa na dge slong rnams yid byung bar gyur te /
translated: Whoever gives up and ruins the training in these noble teachings is said to be like that.‚Äù When this was said, the monks were distressed.

original: yang phyis bsod snyoms la mi 'jug cing zhag gcig kyang kha zas gcod par byed de ji tsam na de dag skya bo bseng bseng por gyur pas de bas na tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: yang phyis bsod snyoms la mi 'jug cing zhag gcig kyang kha zas gcod par byed de ji tsam na de dag skya bo bseng bseng por gyur pas de bas na tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: Later, they did not go out for alms and even fasted for a day. When they became pale and emaciated, the Buddha spoke two verses.

original: 'tsho ba 'di phyir mi bza' mi bya ste //
analyzed: 'tsho ba 'di phyir mi bza' mi bya ste //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not eat for this life or the next.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'tsho ba'i ched du bza' ba dang btung ba ma spyad na ni srog gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'tsho ba'i ched du bza' ba dang btung ba ma spyad na ni srog gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not use food and drink for the sake of living, one's life will not be sustained.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni kham gyi zas kyis gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni kham gyi zas kyis gnas pa yin te /
translated: Beings in the desire realm are sustained by material food,

original: de med na ni de 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na ni de 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: and without it, they perish.

original: gal te de ltar zas dang skom nye bar sbyar ba mchog tu byas pas ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar zas dang skom nye bar sbyar ba mchog tu byas pas ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one uses food and drink in this way, what will happen?üîΩIt is said: Even if one does not nourish the body with material food,

original: smras pa / kham gyi zas kyis lus zhir mi 'gyur yang zhes bya ba kham gyis bcad cing zos zos pa yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / kham gyi zas kyis lus zhir mi 'gyur yang zhes bya ba kham gyis bcad cing zos zos pa yin na yang ngo //
translated: even if one cuts it into pieces and eats it,

original: kham gyis bsnyod pa ni byams pa'i gnas kyi bdag nyid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kham gyis bsnyod pa ni byams pa'i gnas kyi bdag nyid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir brjod par bya'o //
translated: one should be like a person who is a field of love, etc.

original: de la yang 'di la lhag par mang du zos par gyur na yang sems zhi bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de la yang 'di la lhag par mang du zos par gyur na yang sems zhi bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, it should be said that even if one eats a lot, the mind does not become peaceful.

original: lus dang sems nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: lus dang sems nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The body and mind do not become tranquil.

original: nad dang dri ma dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nad dang dri ma dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of disease, impurity, and secondary afflictions.

original: de ltar na bza' bar mi bya'o zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar na bza' bar mi bya'o zhe na smras pa /
translated: If one were to think that it should not be eaten, then the root text states,

original: kha zas kyis ni lus dag gnas 'gyur ba //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kha zas kyis ni lus dag gnas 'gyur ba // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The body is sustained by food.

original: kha zas kyis 'jug pa 'di ni lus kyi bdag nyid gnas pa'i dngos po yin te /
analyzed: kha zas kyis 'jug pa 'di ni lus kyi bdag nyid gnas pa'i dngos po yin te /
translated: The process of taking food is the means of sustaining the body.

original: 'gro ba zas kyis gnas pa'o zhes lung las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba zas kyis gnas pa'o zhes lung las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The scriptures state, ‚ÄúThe world is sustained by food.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ni kham gyi zas ma yin par gnas pa med de /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ni kham gyi zas ma yin par gnas pa med de /
translated: There is no life in the desire realm that is not sustained by oral food.

original: ji ltar yang tshad dang ldan pa'i kham gyi zas te kha zas kyi bdag nyid rags pa'am phra ba de'i bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa spyod pa'i @208a * //
analyzed: ji ltar yang tshad dang ldan pa'i kham gyi zas te kha zas kyi bdag nyid rags pa'am phra ba de'i bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa spyod pa'i @208a * //
translated: The body of a desire realm being increases in size through the essence of coarse or subtle oral food, which is measured in terms of morsels.

original: lus rgyas par 'gyur te de thams cad dang bral na ni 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus rgyas par 'gyur te de thams cad dang bral na ni 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one were to be completely devoid of that food, one would die.

original: de ltar rtogs nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes nas so //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes nas so //
translated: Having understood this,

original: bsod snyoms dag la rgyus zhes bya ba bsod snyoms dag yongs su tshol cig pa ste /
analyzed: bsod snyoms dag la rgyus zhes bya ba bsod snyoms dag yongs su tshol cig pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúGo for alms‚Äù means ‚Äúgo to seek alms.‚Äù

original: lus 'tsho ba tsam btsal ba'i rgyus ni ma rung pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'tsho ba tsam btsal ba'i rgyus ni ma rung pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no fault in seeking just enough to sustain the body.

original: de la rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'di ni mkhas pa rnams la ni phan 'dogs pa yin la blun po rnams la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'di ni mkhas pa rnams la ni phan 'dogs pa yin la blun po rnams la ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, gain and honor are helpful to the wise, but not to fools,üîΩbecause the latter fall due to the fault of folly, their virtues decline, and they are tormented by the sting of remorse.

original: gang gi phyir de ni blun pa'i skyon gyis ltung bar 'gyur zhing yon tan las nyams la zug rngu'i gdung ba skye bar 'gyur ro zhes de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni blun pa'i skyon gyis ltung bar 'gyur zhing yon tan las nyams la zug rngu'i gdung ba skye bar 'gyur ro zhes de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: rigs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rigs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy family, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dam zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'bying ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir 'dam zhes mngon par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dam zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'bying ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir 'dam zhes mngon par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMud‚Äù should be understood as mud because it is similar to mud in that one sinks in it.

original: phyag rgyas mchod pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgyas mchod pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSealed with worship‚Äù should be connected.

original: dper na 'dam de la gnas na ni 'bying bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnyed pa dang bkur sti de'i rjes su 'gro na /
analyzed: dper na 'dam de la gnas na ni 'bying bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnyed pa dang bkur sti de'i rjes su 'gro na /
translated: For example, if one dwells in that mud, one sinks.

original: skyon nam sdug bsngal du ltung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyon nam sdug bsngal du ltung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the same way, if one follows after gain and honor, one falls into a fault or suffering.

original: rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu bstan pa dang bshad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu bstan pa dang bshad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of one should understand is the meaning of one should teach and explain.

original: gyis zhes bya ba ni khyed cag gis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gyis zhes bya ba ni khyed cag gis zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of you is the meaning of you all.

original: ci gang zhig bdag gis 'dam dang 'dra bar rab tu rtogs par bya zhe na /üîΩrigs kyis phyag byas mchod pa gang yin 'di //
analyzed: ci gang zhig bdag gis 'dam dang 'dra bar rab tu rtogs par bya zhe na / rigs kyis phyag byas mchod pa gang yin 'di //
translated: What is it that one should understand as being like mud?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩphyag byas pa ni phyag btsal pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / phyag byas pa ni phyag btsal pa'o //
translated: It is this: Those who are worshipped with respect due to family.üîΩHere, worshipped means worshipped with prostrations.

original: mchod pa ni ri mor byas pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni ri mor byas pa'o //
translated: Honor means honored with respect.

original: gang yin 'di zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du nyams su myong ba ste /
analyzed: gang yin 'di zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du nyams su myong ba ste /

analyzed: bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs kyis phyag dang bcas pa'i mchod pas ni bdag la 'dam dang 'dra bar byas pa'o //

original: 'di ni yon tan dag las kyang nyams par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yon tan dag las kyang nyams par byed pa yin te /
translated: This is also a degeneration from virtues.üîΩFor example, it is like a pain that causes a degeneration of health.

original: dper na zug rngus 'tsho ba nyams par byed pa de bzhin no zhes de nyid bstan pa'i phyir zug rngu phra mo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na zug rngus 'tsho ba nyams par byed pa de bzhin no zhes de nyid bstan pa'i phyir zug rngu phra mo zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i zug rngu gang yin pa 'di ni shin tu shes par dka' ste /

original: lus kyi nang du zhugs pa'i mde'u la sogs pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi nang du zhugs pa'i mde'u la sogs pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen as like an arrow that has entered the body.

original: de nam zhig na rgyud las dka' bas 'byin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'byung bar dka' ba ste zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nam zhig na rgyud las dka' bas 'byin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'byung bar dka' ba ste zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is difficult to remove from the mind, he says, ‚Äúdifficult to remove.‚Äù

original: 'bad pas dbyung dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad pas dbyung dgos pa'i phyir ro //

original: mi yis @208b zhes bya ba ni skyes bu blun pos so //
analyzed: mi yis @208b zhes bya ba ni skyes bu blun pos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy a person‚Äù means by a foolish person.

original: shin tu spang bar dka' ba nyi tsher ma zad de dus de nyid du yang spangs par dka'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir spangs dka' zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shin tu spang bar dka' ba nyi tsher ma zad de dus de nyid du yang spangs par dka'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir spangs dka' zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: dus de nyid du yang zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //

original: skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis kyang bde bar spong bar mi nus te ;
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis kyang bde bar spong bar mi nus te ;
translated: Even the holy ones cannot give up happiness easily,

original: don rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: gzhan dag tu ni bzod dka' zhes brjod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag tu ni bzod dka' zhes brjod de /

analyzed: bzod par dka' ba dang zil gyis gnon pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: bkur sti'i tshoms te bcu gsum pa'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bkur sti'i tshoms te bcu gsum pa'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on respect is completed.

translated: In order to prove that, under the influence of excessive attachment to gain and honor, one will be attended by thousands of misfortunes such as flattery, the chapter on flattery is taught next.

analyzed: yang na rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni 'dam dang zug rngu lta bur blta bar bya'o zhes bstan ma thag pa de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'phags skyes po sa sh'akya rnams bsad pa de'i dbang du mdzad pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the two verses are stated from the perspective of Vir≈´·∏çhaka, who killed the ≈öƒÅkyas.

analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa yang bag 'bebs pa dang tha mal pa la sogs pas te /

analyzed: gang gnod pa dang 'khu bar bya ba ma yin pa la'o //
translated: To those who should not be harmed or harmed,üîΩTo those who should not be harmed, to those very ones,

analyzed: ji ltar 'khu bar bya ba ma yin zhe na smras pa /

analyzed: 'khu bar byed pa po nyid la gnod par byed cing nye bar gdung bar byed pa yin no //

analyzed: mthong ba'i chos nyid la grags pa ma yin pa la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: dred dang ru ru'i skyes pa'i rabs dang / ko ka @209a * //
translated: The stories of the bear, the Ruru deer, K·πõ·π£·πáa,
